Create kinetics dataset for a list of peptides and their states

create_kinetic_dataset.Rd

Generates the data set of deuterium uptake between selected time points based on supplied peptide list.

create_kinetic_dataset(
  dat,
  peptide_list,
  protein = dat[["Protein"]][1],
  time_0 = min(dat[["Exposure"]]),
  time_100 = max(dat[["Exposure"]]),
  deut_part = 0.9
)

Arguments

dat

dat data imported by the read_hdx function.
peptide_list

list of peptides for the calculation.
protein

chosen protein.
time_0

minimal exchange control time point of measurement.
time_100

maximal exchange control time point of measurement.
deut_part

deuterium percentage in solution used in experiment, value from range [0, 1].

Value

a data.frame object.

Details

This is a wrapper for calculate_kinetics, but for the peptide list instead of one peptide.

See also

calculate_kinetics calculate_state_uptake plot_kinetics

Examples

dat <- read_hdx(system.file(package = "HaDeX", "HaDeX/data/KD_180110_CD160_HVEM.csv"))

#> [1] ""
peptide_list <- data.frame(Sequence = c("INITSSASQEGTRLN", "INITSSASQEGTRLN"), state = c("CD160", "CD160_HVEM"), start = c(1, 1), end = c(15, 15))
create_kinetic_dataset(dat, peptide_list)

#> # A tibble: 12 x 16
#>    Protein  Sequence        Start   End State      time_chosen Exposure frac_deut_uptake
#>    <chr>    <chr>           <int> <int> <chr>            <dbl>    <dbl>            <dbl>
#>  1 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160            0.001    0.001            0.369
#>  2 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160            0.167    0.167           76.9  
#>  3 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160            1        1               84.3  
#>  4 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160            5        5               87.6  
#>  5 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160           25       25               93.2  
#>  6 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160          120      120               95.5  
#>  7 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160_HVEM       0.001    0.001            0.372
#>  8 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160_HVEM       0.167    0.167           74.5  
#>  9 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160_HVEM       1        1               81.6  
#> 10 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160_HVEM       5        5               83.0  
#> 11 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160_HVEM      25       25               87.7  
#> 12 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160_HVEM     120      120               95.2  
#> # ... with 8 more variables: err_frac_deut_uptake <dbl>, deut_uptake <dbl>,
#> #   err_deut_uptake <dbl>, theo_frac_deut_uptake <dbl>,
#> #   err_theo_frac_deut_uptake <dbl>, theo_deut_uptake <dbl>,
#> #   err_theo_deut_uptake <dbl>, Med_Sequence <dbl>

peptide_list2 <- data.frame(Sequence = c("INITSSASQEGTRLN", "LICTVW"), state = c("CD160", "CD160"), start = c(1, 16), end = c(15, 21))
create_kinetic_dataset(dat, peptide_list2)

#> # A tibble: 12 x 16
#>    Protein  Sequence        Start   End State time_chosen Exposure frac_deut_uptake

#>  5 db_CD160 INITSSASQEGTRLN     1    15 CD160      25       25              93.2
